1960 book edited by [[Ida Gordon]]: The Seafarer]]", published in the series ''Methuen's Old English Library'' (general editors Arthur Brown and [[Alan Bliss
[[Old English]] poem: A.J. Bliss]]).<ref>Ida Gordon (1960), ''The Seafarer''</ref> Initially prepared by [[E.V. Gordon]] (the husband of [[Ida Gordon
[[The Seafarer (poem)]]}}: I.L. Gordon]]) and [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], the work remained unpublished when the former died in 1938.<ref>[[Verlyn Flieger]], ''[[A Question of Time]]'' (2001), p. 262</ref> Ida Gordon reworked the uncompleted draft and published the edition in 1960. Because of the large revision, ''The Seafarer'' was published in her own name, but "Tolkien's work and assistance were generously acknowledged."<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: A Reader's Guide'' (2006), p. 347</ref>

{{disambig-two: In 1996, a new edition of the publication appeared (University of Exeter Press, ISBN 0-85989-507-6), which includes a 16-pages Bibliography compiled by Mary Clayton.<ref>Ida Gordon, Mary Clayton (1996), ''The Seafarer''</ref>

*Note: This publication is included in [[Pieter Collier]]'s "List of all Tolkien books".<ref>[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/collecting/list.htm Collecting Tolkien Books] at [http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/index.php Tolkienlibrary.com], as of 8 September 2010</ref>

[...] I have submitted the edition under my own name because it represents a view of the poem basically different from that of the original draft.
